meta.name: description
meta.content: 204 No Content indicates the request was successful and the response has no body.

main.p: The 204 No Content status code indicates that the request was successful and the response has no body.
Use 204 No Content when the status code would normally be 200 OK but the payload size would be zero. These are typically PUT, PATCH, or DELETE requests made with return=minimal.

Servers that would like to send a more specific status code, such as 201 Created if a resource was created, but without a response body, should use the more specific status code instead, and use a Content-Length: 0 header field instead.
This status code implies the request has been filled. If the request does not need to be filled because of a conditional header, see 304 Not Modified.

Handling of 204 No Content is the same as a 200 OK with a zero-length payload, even if the server omits the Content-Length and Transfer-Encoding headers, one of which would normally be necessary in HTTP/1.1.

dl.dd: The request was successful and the response has no body.
